heading: aussies sound smut alert
subheading: the australian government invites community-minded citizens to ferret out net porn.
author: wired news report
text: the australian government is preparing to embark on a crusade against online porn, the *sydney morning herald * reported friday. the government initiative will reportedly depend on the volunteer efforts of australian citizens. under the plan, web watchers who come across online porn will be invited to submit complaints to the australian broadcasting authority.that agency will notify internet service providers and force them to remove the material....japanese porn poster sentenced: a japanese court in osaka convicted a man of internet obscenity friday for posting obscene images to a server in the united states, the japan economic newswire reported.the 32-year-old man pleaded innocent to the charges, but was convicted and sentenced to 18 months in prison on a three-year suspended sentence.even though the web server was located in the united states, the presiding judge reportedly ruled that atushi maekawa would be tried under japanese obscenity laws, because he intended the images to be viewed by japanese citizens.maekawa had been transmitting the images from november 1996 to february 1997, according to the wire report. he contended that he could not be tried under japanese law since he was transmitting the images from the united states.
